By executing this query, in any manner whatsoever, you agree to abide by these terms.  In some limited cases, domains that might appear as available in whois might not actually be available as they could be already registered and the whois not yet updated and/or they could be part of the Restricted list. In this cases, performing a check through your Registrar's (EPP check) will give you the actual status of the domain. Additionally, domains currently or previously used as extensions in 3rd level domains will not be available for registration in the 2nd level. For example, org.co, mil.co, edu.co, com.co, net.co, nom.co, arts.co, firm.co, info.co, int.co, web.co, rec.co, co.co.", '', 'NOTE: FAILURE TO LOCATE A RECORD IN THE WHOIS DATABASE IS NOT INDICATIVE OF THE AVAILABILITY OF A DOMAIN NAME. thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain is not currently registered and is pending deletion. This indicates that the website may not be legitimate or is no longer in operation. The presence of a privacy service (WhoisGuard) is common, but in conjunction with other red flags, it can be a sign of a scam. Since the website content suggested that the domain had been suspended, and the WHOIS indicates it is pending deletion, this could be a potential scam or a defunct website. Before I provide a final answer, I should check if there are any public complaints or reports about this domain being involved in scams.
observation: [{'url': 'https://theblogsocieties.com/6-ways-to-spot-a-blogging-scam/', 'content': "As a new industry, scammers are taking advantage and preying on the eagerness of the industry to grow, make money and collaborate. We're seeing this blogging scam time and time again, Instagram accounts getting hacked, bloggers not getting paid for partnerships, or product showing up that isn't what it was expected. Avoiding these blogging scams and illegitimate businesses is part of the job."}, {'url': 'https://www.reddit.com/r/cybersecurity_help/comments/u8iwv5/what_should_you_do_if_get_a_pop_up_website_fake/', 'content': "ctrl-alt-delete, use task manager to kill the browser, install an ad blocker, and continue with your life. If it could secretly download something they wouldn't bother with trying to scam you and instead just straight up deliver malware. 2. true."}, {'url': 'https://www.bbb.org/all/spot-a-scam/how-to-identify-a-fake-website', 'content': "Look closely at the domain name. One way fake websites trick people is by using a domain name that is extremely close to a real business' or organization's domain name. Upon closer examination ..."}, {'url': 'https://www.reddit.com/r/isthisascam/comments/q5w9tl/pop_30_at_my_school_seems_sus_is_it_a_scam/', 'content': "But, it is like any of these types of things. thought: The certificate information indicates that certificates were issued for the domain, but they have all expired as of July 25, 2022. This further suggests that the website may not be actively maintained, which aligns with the domain being in pendingDelete status. Considering that the website's content also suggested the domain had expired and that the WHOIS information indicates a pending deletion, I have gathered enough evidence to conclude that this URL is not trustworthy and exhibits several characteristics of a scam website, particularly the lack of current registration, prior suspension, and lack of maintenance indicated by the expired certificates. I now know the final answer. Based on the WHOIS data indicating the domain is pending deletion and the content accessed from the URL that suggested prior suspension, it is likely that this website is either not legitimate or no longer in operation. There is insufficient evidence to definitively classify it as a scam, but the signs point towards it being potentially untrustworthy or defunct.

observation.reason: The domain was previously suspended WHOIS information indicates the domain is pending deletion and not currently registered the domain's information is redacted for privacy and the SSL certificates have expired. These factors suggest the site is not actively maintained and likely a scam.
